text: Just wondering anyone else’s designers starting to work in Adobe XD? just wondering if you have any workflow tips on the dev side. I’m just finding some things to be a little annoying to have to do
like having to add lines to a design so I can get measurements, because there is no measure tool
If you use the Select tool to select an object, then hold down the Alt key, as you hover over other objects the measurement between them will be shown
<@U7SL518D6> are you moving from Sketch to Adobe?
very useful tip, thank you!
moving from PSD mocks to Adobe XD
You’re welcome!

I’m just finding that the adobe XD experience for pulling out Assets and getting information out of it that I need to code is either lacking, or is often not obvious. For example the alt key thing.

Then the Publish design specs feature only gets you so far then you have to dive back into the file itself again to get stuff that it can’t handle. It just feels like while they’re headed in the right direction. They are still figuring out the developer hand-off.
Oh I thought you were making the XD laughing face
I went from PS to Illustrator then Sketch. Still prefer Illustrator but I can’t be the only one on the team who uses it.
I like illustrator and I like photoshop. I also get where Adobe’s intending to go with XD just doesn’t feel as polished as photoshop or illustrator
I use a combo of PS/AI with Invision Board
I wasnt a fan of XD, didnt like the presentation to the client
Sketch kind of feels incomplete to me also since it can’t handle SVG editing.
I miss Illustrator :disappointed:
Sketch is my betch. What do you mean on the SVG front? I've never had an issue
Like if I import a complex SVG it flips out if I start trying to move the vector points around
Also… where my glyphs at
What I do like about it is you can have a super tall concept
plugins lol. IDK, maybe all my SVGs are too basic lol
try Gravit, i've been using it for isometric icons (though I am horrible at them as im just starting it)
<https://designer.io/>
I’ll check it out!
nice, I'd been using Affinity for all my non-ui vector needs
Both <@UCDCS9KCP> and I do the design and dev for our agency and work in XD. Feel free to throw specific questions our way :smile:
